Same here, also 0.28.1. Also please help :)

Sorry, something went wrong
500 - Internal Server Error
Stacktrace
         Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/superset/venv/lib64/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1982, in wsgi_app

KeyError: 'login'
@Mastimind so you export the dashboard created using druid datasources and edit the exported json file?
Would it be possible to add **dropna**  in the pivot table options? or in the chart json ?

I deployed superset using docker
https://superset.incubator.apache.org/installation.html#start-with-docker
so version is `master`

It seems that 
> Clicking a second time does not clear the filter

still doesn't fixed.

Actually,
after first time clickiing - row is selected, highlighted and other charts (on the same datasource) are refreshed (see requests to server)
after second clicking - row is deselected, but other charts aren't refreshed (no requests at chrome dev tools)

Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label `#bug` to this issue, with a confidence of 0.92. Please mark this comment with :thumbsup: or :thumbsdown: to give our bot feedback! 

 Links: [app homepage](https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot), [dashboard](https://mlbot.net/data/apache/incubator-superset) and [code](https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp) for this bot.

Hi @mashciku,

Please post the stacktrace as text. And send the metadata for the dashboard (at least the json_metadata field)

> Hello there, is there a reason that this feature has not been merged to master or is there someone else working on refactoring and making this better? Just keen to know, so that we can work on it and contribute from our end if any one has a use case. Alternatively, keen on not reinventing the wheel if someone has found a workaround for this. Thanks!

Same here, we are reviewing Superset and multi-tenancy is a must have for us.. Thanks in advance.

> > > Hi! I created a new issue but was unaware of this thread.
> > > I have attempted [a prototype](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/6774) for multi chart and single chart drilldowns using HighCharts (for now).
> > > I agree drilldown is a needed feature as it is more intuitive for the end user to filter charts and if anyone is willing to follow up on this idea please do reply to this post :)
> > 
> > 
> > I'm in how far did you got, wanna do some collaboration?
> 
> Sure! I have created a guided flow drilldown thus far.
> 
> However, as of right now, it only supports normal groupby filtering (does not support time-based filtering). So would you like to help me on that?

Hi @pavitranrambo, I would like to help as well if this still relevant, please share a PR or some GitHub code and let us know what is needed.

Issue was not resolved by the changes were made. In particular issue is about "Table Timestamp Format " which is on Customize tab of the Table viz control panel (and not about Time Grain). Expected that format selected in the Table Timestamp Format dropdown will be applied to the main dttm column values. Currently it is not.
Superset version is ebb7fbc5f024379361f301a86b770e0cc1a932cd
Could you share how to reproduce the issue?
Have you `npm install`?

Hi @wooram1125,

I'll submit a fix for it.
Could you add screenshots to show the before/after of the change? Thanks!

@schoel-bis Are you sure this is the issue here? I've been investigating this same issue and am pretty sure the root cause is here: https://github.com/apache-superset/superset-ui-plugins/blob/master/packages/superset-ui-legacy-preset-chart-nvd3/src/NVD3Vis.js#L1081

We're removing all tooltips on the page whenever we rerender a chart, which is problematic especially on dashboards where multiple charts could have tooltips in the DOM. If your fix solves the issue here, than awesome, but I think there's another deeper problem that needs to be solved with the nvd3 chart plugin

Sure.

Before (note the highlighted dots in the chart on the left from hovering):

![Bildschirmfoto von 2019-07-26 20-03-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11717833/61972288-84addd00-afe1-11e9-8f25-551012cabdc8.png)

After:

![Bildschirmfoto von 2019-07-26 20-03-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11717833/61972292-8677a080-afe1-11e9-8089-90971a555cf9.png)

Well, frankly I wouldn't bet on this being the one and only problem with tooltips or NVD3 on Firefox or anywhere. Anyway, I wasn't seeing any tooltips whatsoever in Firefox and with that patch applied I have them back.
@xtinec maybe you can confirm this as a side effect of your commit ?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions. For admin, please label this issue `.pinned` to prevent stale bot from closing the issue.

@mistercrunch it seems like the CI is failing because the license check is not running against Python 3.6 (I speculate it's Python 2.7) as it can't find the `black` package. I think the fix is to add `deps =` [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/tox.ini#L118). 

Note I think it's probably fine for this environment to run in any version of Python given it's merely running a shell script.
I've replicated this.  I thought this was a flaw in my installation, but apparently not.
Issue Label Bot is not confident enough to auto-label this issue. See [dashboard](https://mlbot.net/data/apache/incubator-superset) for more details.

`pip freeze` and check if `superset` is installed

I fixed this issue in this PR, please merge it.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/7940
@blcksrx I merged your PR, however this PR is somewhat different, i.e., it removes an unnecessary installation of the `codecov` package.

> @blcksrx I merged your PR, however this PR is somewhat different, i.e., it removes an unnecessary installation of the `codecov` package.

Thanks. I've just working for @alopeyk company and i tried to solve the bug that i expalined on the PR.

Some general comments:
- I clicked around the application as much as I could, including reloading the examples data, but was unable to produce any messy errors. So functionally this seems solid.
- The `try`/`except` additions in `connectors/druid/models.py` still feel slightly messy, but I feel they should be acceptable given the tradeoff of being able to drop problematic licenses. This is also something I feel we can get improve later if needed. Here I think @mistercrunch @john-bodley @betodealmeida could weigh in with comments on whether or not the current solution is appropriate.
- One bigger problem that still needs to be addressed is that the tests that require `pydruid` are now not run as part of CI. Ideally we would install `pydruid` and `requests` when running CI to make sure the Druid tests are run, but I'm unsure what Apache Legal thinks of this. @mistercrunch should we check with them if it's ok to use these deps in our CI setup? I can do the asking if necessary.

Up. 
There's a common case - cohort analysis - e.g. having a table of events (thus event_date time dimension) with a "cohort_date" (another time dimension) column per event row showing the cohort date of the user we have event for. So 2 time dims and of course it would be highly desirable to have an ability to use dynamic UI time filters for bother of them - so to be able to say - show me events happened withing a time range for a cohort of users of April'2018.

Please advise on any meaningful workaround.
Should be good to go

@etr2460 @graceguo-supercat Are you able to reproduce this bug? I tried to check the filterbox sources, but was unsuccessful finding what's causing this behaviour. Any hints on where to look would be appreciated..

@sturmer I think it would make sense to rebase this PR; there's been quite a bit of changes to the CI config files, and it would be good to make sure the tests are successful with the new confs. Also, I would suggest adding `pydruid` and `requests` from `requirements.txt` to `requirements-dev.txt`, as CI won't be able to run the tests for Druid otherwise. I'm sure it should be ok to keep the deps in the dev requirements, as installing those is optional (not pulled in by default), and hence should be ok with Apache policies.
